result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey D. Ramos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey D. Ramos is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey D. Ramos was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 15CF88.  Deft requests credit for 2 days if revoked.  Expungement will be granted upon successful completion of the sentence.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION court imposes 120 days KCJ.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey D. Ramos

records.addlTxt: Court's handwritten note on deft's correspondence which was received on 1/12/17 - "120 days of CJT was to start 9/28/16.  Not done yet."  Copy sent to deft on 1/24/17
from deft which states he has completed his ATR and/or the 120 days KCJ imposed by the Court; requests the Court inform the jail to release him
As a condition of probation court imposes 120 days KCJ.  kmk

Minutes:  15CF88/15CF459.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Agent Elizabeth Lemcke present.  Brief discussion held.  Deft sentenced to 120 days KCJ as a condition of probation on 15CF459.
from Agent Elizabeth Lemcke
Cassi Baumgardner  kmk
Cts.1&3 -Dismissed  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk

Minutes:  15CF88/15CF335/15CF459.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Cases are resolved.  

15CF88 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Parties waive PSI.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years concurrent to 15CF459.  If revoked, deft requests credit for 2 days.  

15CF459 - deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Parties waive PSI.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years concurrent to 15CF88.  If revoked, deft requests credit for 2 days.  

15CF335 - case dismissed on State's motion.

EXPUNCTION WILL BE GRANTED UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION.

DEPT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL NOT ISSUE A CERTIFICATE OF DISCHARGE WITHOUT PRIOR CONSULTATION W/THE COURT IF THE DEFT HAS NOT FULFILLED ALL OF THE COURT'S CONDITIONS SUPERVISION

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Hilary Edwards. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-10-15 @ 10:10am. Jury selection on 7-20-15 @ 9:00am with 15CF335 and 15CF88. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
filed by Atty. Hilary Edwards  kmk
Hilary Edwards  kmk
At the request of Atty. Edwards, preliminary hearing rescheduled from 9:00am to 8:30am on 6-3-15. DA's Office notified.

1:27 pm    Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk:  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 6-3-15 @ 9:00 am.  $2500 signature bond set with conditions.  Warrant vacated

*Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.
